template.description: This template is a combination of two flows. The first is an acquistion hub and the second is for processing. In a real world deployment they would be on separate clusters and use Site to Site to communicate. I included both of them in one flow to it would be easier to see the and distribute. As a note, ending flows with UpdateAttribute is merely a way to indicate the end of line. It is a common way developers cap off their flows.
template.name: Acqusition and Processing

allowableValues.description: A copy of the FlowFile will be routed to each relationship whose corresponding expression evaluates to 'true'
Requires that all user-defined expressions evaluate to 'true' for the FlowFile to be considered a match
Requires that at least one user-defined expression evaluate to 'true' for hte FlowFile to be considered a match

value.description: Specifies how to determine which relationship to use when evaluating the Expression Language
value.name: Routing Strategy

relationships.description: FlowFiles that do not match any user-define expression will be routed here
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: The API Key that is registered with Yandex
value.name: Yandex API Key

value.description: The language of incoming data
value.name: Input Language

value.description: The language to translate the text into
value.name: Target Language

value.description: Specifies whether or not the content should be translated. If false, only the text specified by user-defined properties will be translated.
value.name: Translate Content

value.description: Specifies the character set of the data to be translated
value.name: Character Set

relationships.description: This relationship is used when the translation fails due to a problem such as a network failure, and for which the translation should be attempted again
relationships.name: comms.failure

relationships.description: This relationship is used when the translation is successful
relationships.name: success

relationships.description: This relationship is used if the translation cannot be performed for some reason other than communications failure
relationships.name: translation.failure

value.description: Determines the number of Relationships to which the load should be distributed
value.name: Number of Relationships

value.description: Determines how the load will be distributed. If using Round Robin, will not distribute any FlowFiles unless all destinations can accept FlowFiles; when using Next Available, will distribute FlowFiles as long as at least 1 destination can accept FlowFiles.
value.name: Distribution Strategy

relationships.description: Where to route flowfiles for this relationship index
Where to route flowfiles for this relationship index
All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Path to Maxmind Geo Enrichment Database File
value.name: Geo Database File

value.description: The name of an attribute whose value is a dotted decimal IP address for which enrichment should occur
value.name: IP Address Attribute

relationships.description: Where to route flow files after successfully enriching attributes with geo data
relationships.name: found

relationships.description: Where to route flow files after unsuccessfully enriching attributes because no geo data was found
relationships.name: not found

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file) in order to apply the regular expressions. Files larger than the specified maximum will not be fully evaluated.
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

value.description: Indicates that two characters match only when their full canonical decompositions match.
value.name: Enable Canonical Equivalence

value.description: Indicates that two characters match even if they are in a different case. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?i).
value.name: Enable Case-insensitive Matching

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: In this mode, whitespace is ignored, and embedded comments starting with # are ignored until the end of a line. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?x).
value.displayName: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
value.name: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: Indicates that the expression '.' should match any character, including a line terminator. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?s).
value.name: Enable DOTALL Mode

entry.key: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: Indicates that Metacharacters and escape characters should be given no special meaning.
value.displayName: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern
value.name: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: Indicates that '^' and '$' should match just after and just before a line terminator or end of sequence, instead of only the begining or end of the entire input. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?m).
value.name: Enable Multiline Mode

value.description: When used with 'Enable Case-insensitive Matching', matches in a manner consistent with the Unicode Standard. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?u).
value.name: Enable Unicode-aware Case Folding

value.description: Specifies conformance with the Unicode Technical Standard #18: Unicode Regular Expression Annex C: Compatibility Properties. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?U).
value.name: Enable Unicode Predefined Character Classes

value.description: Indicates that only the ' ' line terminator is recognized int the behavior of '.', '^', and '$'. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?d).
value.name: Enable Unix Lines Mode

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the Regular Expression is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when no provided Regular Expression matches the content of the FlowFile
relationships.name: unmatched

allowableValues.description: A copy of the FlowFile will be routed to each relationship whose corresponding expression evaluates to 'true'
Requires that all user-defined expressions evaluate to 'true' for the FlowFile to be considered a match
Requires that at least one user-defined expression evaluate to 'true' for hte FlowFile to be considered a match

value.description: Specifies how to determine which relationship to use when evaluating the Expression Language
value.name: Routing Strategy

relationships.description: FlowFiles will be routed to 'match' if one or all Expressions match, depending on the configuration of the Routing Strategy property
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles that do not match any user-define expression will be routed here
relationships.name: unmatched

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

allowableValues.description: Generates 'bins' of FlowFiles and fills each bin as full as possible. FlowFiles are placed into a bin based on their size and optionally their attributes (if the <Correlation Attribute> property is set)

Combines fragments that are associated by attributes back into a single cohesive FlowFile. If using this strategy, all FlowFiles must have the attributes <fragment.identifier>, <fragment.count>, and <fragment.index> or alternatively (for backward compatibility purposes) <segment.identifier>, <segment.count>, and <segment.index>. All FlowFiles with the same value for "fragment.identifier" will be grouped together. All FlowFiles in this group must have the same value for the "fragment.count" attribute. All FlowFiles in this group must have a unique value for the "fragment.index" attribute between 0 and the value of the "fragment.count" attribute.

value.description: Specifies the algorithm used to merge content. The 'Defragment' algorithm combines fragments that are associated by attributes back into a single cohesive FlowFile. The 'Bin-Packing Algorithm' generates a FlowFile populated by arbitrarily chosen FlowFiles
value.name: Merge Strategy

allowableValues.description: A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single TAR file. The FlowFiles' <path> attribute will be used to create a directory in the TAR file if the <Keep Paths> property is set to true; otherwise, all FlowFiles will be added at the root of the TAR file. If a FlowFile has an attribute named <tar.permissions> that is 3 characters, each between 0-7, that attribute will be used as the TAR entry's 'mode'.

A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single ZIP file. The FlowFiles' <path> attribute will be used to create a directory in the ZIP file if the <Keep Paths> property is set to true; otherwise, all FlowFiles will be added at the root of the ZIP file. The <Compression Level> property indicates the ZIP compression to use.
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 3 FlowFile Stream
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 2 FlowFile Stream
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 1 FlowFile Package
The contents of all FlowFiles will be concatenated together into a single FlowFile

value.description: Determines the format that will be used to merge the content.
value.name: Merge Format

value.description: Determines which FlowFile attributes should be added to the bundle. If 'Keep All Unique Attributes' is selected, any attribute on any FlowFile that gets bundled will be kept unless its value conflicts with the value from another FlowFile. If 'Keep Only Common Attributes' is selected, only the attributes that exist on all FlowFiles in the bundle, with the same value, will be preserved.
value.name: Attribute Strategy

value.description: If specified, like FlowFiles will be binned together, where 'like FlowFiles' means FlowFiles that have the same value for this Attribute. If not specified, FlowFiles are bundled by the order in which they are pulled from the queue.
value.name: Correlation Attribute Name

value.description: The minimum number of files to include in a bundle
value.name: Minimum Number of Entries

value.description: The maximum number of files to include in a bundle. If not specified, there is no maximum.
value.name: Maximum Number of Entries

value.description: The minimum size of for the bundle
value.name: Minimum Group Size

value.description: The maximum size for the bundle. If not specified, there is no maximum.
value.name: Maximum Group Size

value.description: The maximum age of a Bin that will trigger a Bin to be complete. Expected format is <duration> <time unit> where <duration> is a positive integer and time unit is one of seconds, minutes, hours
value.name: Max Bin Age

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of bins that can be held in memory at any one time
value.name: Maximum number of Bins

allowableValues.description: The values of Header, Footer, and Demarcator will be retrieved from the contents of a file
The values of Header, Footer, and Demarcator will be specified as property values

value.description: Determines if Header, Footer, and Demarcator should point to files containing the respective content, or if the values of the properties should be used as the content.
value.name: Delimiter Strategy

value.description: Filename specifying the header to use. If not specified, no header is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.
value.name: Header File

value.description: Filename specifying the footer to use. If not specified, no footer is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.
value.name: Footer File

value.description: Filename specifying the demarcator to use. If not specified, no demarcator is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.
value.name: Demarcator File

value.description: Specifies the compression level to use when using the Zip Merge Format; if not using the Zip Merge Format, this value is ignored
value.name: Compression Level

value.description: If using the Zip or Tar Merge Format, specifies whether or not the FlowFiles' paths should be included in their entry names; if using other merge strategy, this value is ignored
value.name: Keep Path

relationships.description: If the bundle cannot be created, all FlowFiles that would have been used to created the bundle will be transferred to failure
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The FlowFile containing the merged content
relationships.name: merged

relationships.description: The FlowFiles that were used to create the bundle
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: If the bundle cannot be created, all FlowFiles that would have been used to created the bundle will be transferred to failure
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The FlowFile containing the merged content
relationships.name: merged

relationships.description: The FlowFiles that were used to create the bundle
relationships.name: original

value.description: Indicates whether the processor should compress content or decompress content. Must be either 'compress' or 'decompress'
value.name: Mode

value.description: The compression format to use. Valid values are: GZIP, BZIP2, XZ-LZMA2, and LZMA
value.name: Compression Format

value.description: The compression level to use; this is valid only when using GZIP compression. A lower value results in faster processing but less compression; a value of 0 indicates no compression but simply archiving
value.name: Compression Level

value.description: If true, will remove the filename extension when decompressing data (only if the extension indicates the appropriate compression format) and add the appropriate extension when compressing data
value.name: Update Filename

relationships.description: FlowFiles will be transferred to the failure relationship if they fail to compress/decompress
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles will be transferred to the success relationship after successfully being compressed or decompressed
relationships.name: success

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: Specifies whether the content should be encrypted or decrypted
value.name: Mode

value.description: The Encryption Algorithm to use
value.name: Encryption Algorithm

value.description: The Password to use for encrypting or decrypting the data
value.name: Password

value.description: In a PGP encrypt mode, this keyring contains the public key of the recipient
value.name: public-keyring-file

value.description: In a PGP encrypt mode, this user id of the recipient
value.name: public-key-user-id

value.description: In a PGP decrypt mode, this keyring contains the private key of the recipient
value.name: private-keyring-file

value.description: In a PGP decrypt mode, this is the private keyring passphrase
value.name: private-keyring-passphrase

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be encrypted or decrypted will be routed to failure
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that is successfully encrypted or decrypted will be routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Character Encoding that is used to encode the HL7 data
value.name: Character Encoding

value.description: Specifies a query that will cause any HL7 message matching the query to be routed to the 'hypoglycemia' relationship
value.name: hypoglycemia

value.description: Specifies a query that will cause any HL7 message matching the query to be routed to the 'metabolic-panel' relationship
value.name: metabolic-panel

entry.value: DECLARE result AS REQUIRED OBX SELECT MESSAGE WHERE result.7 = 'L' AND result.1 = 1 AND result.3.1 = 'GLU'
DECLARE order AS REQUIRED OBR SELECT MESSAGE WHERE order.1 = 1 AND order.4.1 = '24323-8'

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be parsed as HL7 will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The original FlowFile that comes into this processor will be routed to this relationship, unless it is routed to 'failure'
relationships.name: original

value.description: The number of lines that will be added to each split file
value.name: Line Split Count

value.description: The number of lines that should be considered part of the header; the header lines will be duplicated to all split files
value.name: Header Line Count

value.description: Whether to remove newlines at the end of each split file. This should be false if you intend to merge the split files later
value.name: Remove Trailing Newlines

relationships.description: If a file cannot be split for some reason, the original file will be routed to this destination and nothing will be routed elsewhere
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The original input file will be routed to this destination when it has been successfully split into 1 or more files
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: The split files will be routed to this destination when an input file is successfully split into 1 or more split files
relationships.name: splits

allowableValues.description: A copy of the FlowFile will be routed to each relationship whose corresponding expression evaluates to 'true'
Requires that all user-defined expressions evaluate to 'true' for the FlowFile to be considered a match
Requires that at least one user-defined expression evaluate to 'true' for hte FlowFile to be considered a match

value.description: Specifies how to determine which relationship to use when evaluating the Expression Language
value.name: Routing Strategy

relationships.description: FlowFiles that do not match any user-define expression will be routed here
relationships.name: unmatched

allowableValues.description: The endpoint that provides public data, aka a 'garden hose'
The endpoint that provides access to all tweets
Endpoint that allows the stream to be filtered by specific terms or User IDs

value.description: Specifies which endpoint data should be pulled from
value.name: Twitter Endpoint

value.description: The Consumer Key provided by Twitter
value.name: Consumer Key

value.description: The Consumer Secret provided by Twitter
value.name: Consumer Secret

value.description: The Acces Token provided by Twitter
value.name: Access Token

value.description: The Access Token Secret provided by Twitter
value.name: Access Token Secret

value.description: A comma-separated list of languages for which tweets should be fetched
value.name: Languages

value.description: A comma-separated list of terms to filter on. Ignored unless Endpoint is set to 'Filter Endpoint'. The filter works such that if any term matches, the status update will be retrieved; multiple terms separated by a space function as an 'AND'. I.e., 'it was, hello' will retrieve status updates that have either 'hello' or both 'it' AND 'was'
value.name: Terms to Filter On

value.description: A comma-separated list of Twitter User ID's to follow. Ignored unless Endpoint is set to 'Filter Endpoint'.
value.name: IDs to Follow

relationships.description: All status updates will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

allowableValues.description: A copy of the FlowFile will be routed to each relationship whose corresponding expression evaluates to 'true'
Requires that all user-defined expressions evaluate to 'true' for the FlowFile to be considered a match
Requires that at least one user-defined expression evaluate to 'true' for hte FlowFile to be considered a match

value.description: Specifies how to determine which relationship to use when evaluating the Expression Language
value.name: Routing Strategy

relationships.description: FlowFiles that do not match any user-define expression will be routed here
relationships.name: unmatched

allowableValues.description: The endpoint that provides public data, aka a 'garden hose'
The endpoint that provides access to all tweets
Endpoint that allows the stream to be filtered by specific terms or User IDs

value.description: Specifies which endpoint data should be pulled from
value.name: Twitter Endpoint

value.description: The Consumer Key provided by Twitter
value.name: Consumer Key

value.description: The Consumer Secret provided by Twitter
value.name: Consumer Secret

value.description: The Acces Token provided by Twitter
value.name: Access Token

value.description: The Access Token Secret provided by Twitter
value.name: Access Token Secret

value.description: A comma-separated list of languages for which tweets should be fetched
value.name: Languages

value.description: A comma-separated list of terms to filter on. Ignored unless Endpoint is set to 'Filter Endpoint'. The filter works such that if any term matches, the status update will be retrieved; multiple terms separated by a space function as an 'AND'. I.e., 'it was, hello' will retrieve status updates that have either 'hello' or both 'it' AND 'was'
value.name: Terms to Filter On

value.description: A comma-separated list of Twitter User ID's to follow. Ignored unless Endpoint is set to 'Filter Endpoint'.
value.name: IDs to Follow

relationships.description: All status updates will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Specifies whether the content should be encrypted or decrypted
value.name: Mode

value.description: The Encryption Algorithm to use
value.name: Encryption Algorithm

value.description: The Password to use for encrypting or decrypting the data
value.name: Password

value.description: In a PGP encrypt mode, this keyring contains the public key of the recipient
value.name: public-keyring-file

value.description: In a PGP encrypt mode, this user id of the recipient
value.name: public-key-user-id

value.description: In a PGP decrypt mode, this keyring contains the private key of the recipient
value.name: private-keyring-file

value.description: In a PGP decrypt mode, this is the private keyring passphrase
value.name: private-keyring-passphrase

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be encrypted or decrypted will be routed to failure
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that is successfully encrypted or decrypted will be routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: Indicates whether the results of the JsonPath evaluation are written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute; if using attribute, must specify the Attribute Name property. If set to flowfile-content, only one JsonPath may be specified, and the property name is ignored.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Indicates the desired return type of the JSON Path expressions. Selecting 'auto-detect' will set the return type to 'json' for a Destination of 'flowfile-content', and 'string' for a Destination of 'flowfile-attribute'.
value.name: Return Type

value.description: Indicates how to handle missing JSON path expressions when destination is set to 'flowfile-attribute'. Selecting 'warn' will generate a warning when a JSON path expression is not found.
value.name: Path Not Found Behavior

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath cannot be evaluated against the content of the FlowFile; for instance, if the FlowFile is not valid JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath does not match the content of the FlowFile and the Destination is set to flowfile-content
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: Specifies whether the content should be encrypted or decrypted
value.name: Mode

value.description: The Encryption Algorithm to use
value.name: Encryption Algorithm

value.description: The Password to use for encrypting or decrypting the data
value.name: Password

value.description: In a PGP encrypt mode, this keyring contains the public key of the recipient
value.name: public-keyring-file

value.description: In a PGP encrypt mode, this user id of the recipient
value.name: public-key-user-id

value.description: In a PGP decrypt mode, this keyring contains the private key of the recipient
value.name: private-keyring-file

value.description: In a PGP decrypt mode, this is the private keyring passphrase
value.name: private-keyring-passphrase

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be encrypted or decrypted will be routed to failure
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that is successfully encrypted or decrypted will be routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: The input directory from which to pull files
value.name: Input Directory

value.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be picked up
value.name: File Filter

value.description: When Recurse Subdirectories is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given regular expression will be scanned
value.name: Path Filter

value.description: The maximum number of files to pull in each iteration
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: If true, the file is not deleted after it has been copied to the Content Repository; this causes the file to be picked up continually and is useful for testing purposes. If not keeping original NiFi will need write permissions on the directory it is pulling from otherwise it will ignore the file.
value.name: Keep Source File

value.description: Indicates whether or not to pull files from subdirectories
value.name: Recurse Subdirectories

value.description: Indicates how long to wait before performing a directory listing
value.name: Polling Interval

value.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored
value.name: Ignore Hidden Files

value.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Minimum File Age

value.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Maximum File Age

value.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled
value.name: Minimum File Size

value.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled
value.name: Maximum File Size

relationships.description: All files are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: Indicates whether the processor should compress content or decompress content. Must be either 'compress' or 'decompress'
value.name: Mode

value.description: The compression format to use. Valid values are: GZIP, BZIP2, XZ-LZMA2, and LZMA
value.name: Compression Format

value.description: The compression level to use; this is valid only when using GZIP compression. A lower value results in faster processing but less compression; a value of 0 indicates no compression but simply archiving
value.name: Compression Level

value.description: If true, will remove the filename extension when decompressing data (only if the extension indicates the appropriate compression format) and add the appropriate extension when compressing data
value.name: Update Filename

relationships.description: FlowFiles will be transferred to the failure relationship if they fail to compress/decompress
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles will be transferred to the success relationship after successfully being compressed or decompressed
relationships.name: success

value.description: Determines the number of Relationships to which the load should be distributed
value.name: Number of Relationships

value.description: Determines how the load will be distributed. If using Round Robin, will not distribute any FlowFiles unless all destinations can accept FlowFiles; when using Next Available, will distribute FlowFiles as long as at least 1 destination can accept FlowFiles.
value.name: Distribution Strategy

relationships.description: Where to route flowfiles for this relationship index
Where to route flowfiles for this relationship index

value.description: Specifies the command to be executed; if just the name of an executable is provided, it must be in the user's environment PATH.
value.name: Command

value.description: The arguments to supply to the executable delimited by white space. White space can be escaped by enclosing it in double-quotes.
value.name: Command Arguments

value.description: If the process is expected to be long-running and produce textual output, a batch duration can be specified so that the output will be captured for this amount of time and a FlowFile will then be sent out with the results and a new FlowFile will be started, rather than waiting for the process to finish before sending out the results
value.name: Batch Duration

value.description: If true will redirect any error stream output of the process to the output stream. This is particularly helpful for processes which write extensively to the error stream or for troubleshooting.
value.name: Redirect Error Stream

relationships.description: All created FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The directory to which files should be written. You may use expression language such as /aa/bb/${path}
value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

value.description: If true, then missing destination directories will be created. If false, flowfiles are penalized and sent to failure.
value.name: Create Missing Directories

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of files that can exist in the output directory
value.name: Maximum File Count

value.description: Sets the lastModifiedTime on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. You may also use expression language such as ${file.lastModifiedTime}.
value.name: Last Modified Time

value.description: Sets the permissions on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be either UNIX rwxrwxrwx with a - in place of denied permissions (e.g. rw-r--r--) or an octal number (e.g. 644). You may also use expression language such as ${file.permissions}.
value.name: Permissions

value.description: Sets the owner on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.owner}.
value.name: Owner

value.description: Sets the group on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.group}.
value.name: Group

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to the output directory for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to the output directory are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The URL to pull from
value.name: URL

value.description: The filename to assign to the file when pulled
value.name: Filename

value.description: The Controller Service to use in order to obtain an SSL Context
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: Username required to access the URL
value.name: Username

value.description: Password required to access the URL
value.name: Password

value.description: How long to wait when attempting to connect to the remote server before giving up
value.name: Connection Timeout

value.description: How long to wait between receiving segments of data from the remote server before giving up and discarding the partial file
value.name: Data Timeout

value.description: What to report as the User Agent when we connect to the remote server
value.name: User Agent

value.description: If specified, requests will only accept the provided Content-Type
value.name: Accept Content-Type

value.description: If we receive a 3xx HTTP Status Code from the server, indicates whether or not we should follow the redirect that the server specifies
value.name: Follow Redirects

value.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Host

value.description: The port of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Port

relationships.description: All files are transferred to the success relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Indicates whether the processor should compress content or decompress content. Must be either 'compress' or 'decompress'
value.name: Mode

value.description: The compression format to use. Valid values are: GZIP, BZIP2, XZ-LZMA2, and LZMA
value.name: Compression Format

value.description: The compression level to use; this is valid only when using GZIP compression. A lower value results in faster processing but less compression; a value of 0 indicates no compression but simply archiving
value.name: Compression Level

value.description: If true, will remove the filename extension when decompressing data (only if the extension indicates the appropriate compression format) and add the appropriate extension when compressing data
value.name: Update Filename

relationships.description: FlowFiles will be transferred to the failure relationship if they fail to compress/decompress
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles will be transferred to the success relationship after successfully being compressed or decompressed
relationships.name: success

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to success
relationships.name: success
